medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Headaches began approximately 4 months earlier with severe headaches occurring up to three times per month, lasting 3 hours to 8 days (usually 1 to 2 days) and improving with medication. Pain rated as 5 to 7 on a scale of 1 to 10, described as pounding, starting from the back of the head to the forehead, associated with dizziness, nausea, neck pain, and mosaic vision. They were typically relieved by sleep. Symptoms have gradually developed over time, culminating in daily headaches that were severe and associated with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Recent sinusitis treated with antibiotics and nasal spray; no known allergies or chronic illnesses specified.
medical_history.family_history: Father had a transient ischemic attack and headaches; mother has diabetes mellitus with complications; brother is healthy; no family history of migraine.
medical_history.social_history: Patient is a good student and competitive athlete who has curtailed activity due to headaches. Lives with family; does not smoke, drink, or use illicit drugs; no recent travel.
